name: sfchronicle
text:
BART shaved off $12 millon from its budget deficit and hopes to save millions more with a staff retirement incentive program approved Thursday. The agency says the savings will help it avoid layoffs for now.

https://t.co/2PBnuAUSfg

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Mateo supervisor David Canepa voiced opposition to Gov. Newsom’s curfew.

“As far as I know the disease is just as deadly between 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. as it is from 10 p.m. to 5 a.m.,” Canepa’s statement said.

https://t.co/jL6qzyL9Pm

name: sfchronicle
text: How one winemaker is coping with losing 2020 vintage to wildfires? It involves pears. https://t.co/0M0jXrdCGF

name: sfchronicle
text:
St. Mary’s alums Jordan Ford and Malik Fitts will remain teammates at least for a while in the pros. Each has signed a free-agent contract with the Los Angeles Clippers.

https://t.co/I3P9IYBfks

name: sfchronicle
text:
While most big public health orders about coronavirus restrictions have come from Gov. Gavin Newsom, he did not join an afternoon news conference with Health and Human Services Secretary Mark Ghaly to unveil California’s new overnight curfew.

https://t.co/tV0pUcswEG

name: sfchronicle
text:
The rate of positive coronavirus tests in California has increased by 52% over the past two weeks, Health and Human Services Secretary Mark Ghaly says.

https://t.co/vfLTTj8y9A

name: sfchronicle
text:
The 49ers have placed two more players on the COVID-19 list: offensive lineman Hroniss Grasu and linebacker Joe Walker.

https://t.co/9L3dCZ2lp6

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
When does the curfew start? Which counties are impacted? Will I be arrested if I go to the grocery store at 10:30pm? 

We're answering questions as they come up here — keep checking back for more info: https://t.co/wDuAZjZ2QR

name: sfchronicle
text:
California’s new overnight curfew is enforceable, but HHS secretary Dr. Mark Ghaly declined to specify what that might look like. Sheriffs in several counties, including Sacramento and Fresno, have already said they do not plan to enforce the curfew.

https://t.co/Epxcomecqa

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
Four S.F. supervisors said Thursday that they would draft legislation to “stop the rapid dismantling of the hotel program” and instead keep the rooms open as COVID-19 cases surge.

https://t.co/1qklewY7yi

name: sfchronicle
text:
California's curfew order will apply to all counties in the purple reopening tier. 

Here's a map showing which counties are in purple — right now, it's about 95% of the state. https://t.co/Ix5JuhLVNt https://t.co/RriNTSQlSY

name: sfchronicle
text:
A plan to build housing on 8 acres of asphalt surrounding the El Cerrito Plaza BART Station passed a significant milestone Thursday, as the transit agency’s board of directors picked a development team to build the project.

Story by @SFJKDineen: https://t.co/geqpTIRHIR

name: sfchronicle
text:
A small group of anti-mask protesters extended their arms in a Nazi salute and yelled “sieg heil” before a Solano County Board of Supervisors meeting on Tuesday, angry they were required to follow virus-prevention guidelines.

Story by @michaeldamianw: https://t.co/RrHcZRmaEo https://t.co/CPOVWssBaa

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
California was not the only state to issue tighter coronavirus restrictions. 

New Hampshire issued a statewide mask mandate. Maine added a temporary curfew for some businesses. Rhode Island announced it will issue a “two-week pause” beginning Nov. 30

https://t.co/Ko0rZKxGfV

name: sfchronicle
text:
